verses.verse: Why <S%G3767><s%> laying <S%G659><s%> aside <S%G659><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> malice, <S%G2549><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> guile, <S%G1388><s%> and hypocrisies, <S%G5272><s%> and envies, <S%G5355><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> evil <S%G2636><s%> speakings, <S%G2636><s%>
As newborn <S%G738><s%> babes, <S%G1025><s%> desire <S%G1971><s%> the sincere <S%G97><s%> milk <S%G1051><s%> of the word, <S%G3050><s%> that you may grow <S%G837><s%> thereby: <S%G1722><s%>
If <S%G1512><s%> so be you have tasted <S%G1089><s%> that the Lord <S%G2962><s%> is gracious. <S%G5543><s%>

To whom <S%G3739><s%> coming, <S%G4334><s%> as to a living <S%G2198><s%> stone, <S%G3037><s%> disallowed <S%G593><s%> indeed <S%G3303><s%> of men, <S%G444><s%> but chosen <S%G1588><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> and precious, <S%G1784><s%>

You also, <S%G2532><s%> as lively <S%G2198><s%> stones, <S%G3037><s%> are built <S%G3618><s%> up a spiritual <S%G4152><s%> house, <S%G3624><s%> an holy <S%G40><s%> priesthood, <S%G2406><s%> to offer <S%G399><s%> up spiritual <S%G4152><s%> sacrifices, <S%G2378><s%> acceptable <S%G2144><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> by Jesus <S%G2424><s%> Christ. <S%G5547><s%>

Why <S%G1352><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> it is contained <S%G4023><s%> in the scripture, <S%G1124><s%> Behold, <S%G2400><s%> I lay <S%G5087><s%> in Sion <S%G4622><s%> a chief <S%G204><s%> corner <S%G204><s%> stone, <S%G3037><s%> elect, <S%G1588><s%> precious: <S%G1784><s%> and he that believes <S%G4100><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> him shall not be confounded. <S%G2617><s%>

To you therefore <S%G3767><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> believe <S%G4100><s%> he is precious: <S%G5092><s%> but to them which be disobedient, <S%G544><s%> the stone <S%G3037><s%> which the builders <S%G3618><s%> disallowed, <S%G593><s%> the same <S%G3778><s%> is made <S%G1096><s%> the head <S%G2776><s%> of the corner, <S%G1137><s%>

And a stone <S%G3037><s%> of stumbling, <S%G4348><s%> and a rock <S%G4073><s%> of offense, <S%G4625><s%> even to them which <S%G3739><s%> stumble <S%G4350><s%> at the word, <S%G3056><s%> being disobedient: <S%G544><s%> whereunto <S%G1519><s%> <S%G3739><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> they were appointed. <S%G5087><s%>

But you are a chosen <S%G1588><s%> generation, <S%G1085><s%> a royal <S%G934><s%> priesthood, <S%G2406><s%> an holy <S%G40><s%> nation, <S%G1484><s%> a peculiar <S%G1519><s%> <S%G4047><s%> people; <S%G2992><s%> that you should show <S%G1804><s%> forth <S%G1804><s%> the praises <S%G703><s%> of him who has called <S%G2564><s%> you out of darkness <S%G4655><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> his marvelous <S%G2298><s%> light; <S%G5457><s%>

Which <S%G3588><s%> in time <S%G4218><s%> past were not a people, <S%G2992><s%> but are now <S%G3568><s%> the people <S%G2992><s%> of God: <S%G2316><s%> which <S%G3588><s%> had not obtained <S%G1653><s%> mercy, <S%G1653><s%> but now <S%G3568><s%> have obtained <S%G1653><s%> mercy. <S%G1653><s%>

Dearly beloved, <S%G27><s%> I beseech <S%G3870><s%> you as strangers <S%G3941><s%> and pilgrims, <S%G3927><s%> abstain <S%G567><s%> from fleshly <S%G4559><s%> lusts, <S%G1939><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> war <S%G4754><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> the soul; <S%G5590><s%>

Having <S%G2192><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> conversation <S%G391><s%> honest <S%G2570><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> the Gentiles: <S%G1484><s%> that, whereas <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3759><s%> they speak <S%G2635><s%> against <S%G1909><s%> you as evildoers, <S%G2555><s%> they may by your <S%G3588><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> works, <S%G2041><s%> which they shall behold, <S%G2029><s%> glorify <S%G1392><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> in the day <S%G2250><s%> of visitation. <S%G1984><s%>

Submit <S%G5293><s%> yourselves to every <S%G3956><s%> ordinance <S%G2937><s%> of man <S%G442><s%> for the Lord's <S%G2962><s%> sake: whether <S%G1535><s%> it be to the king, <S%G935><s%> as supreme; <S%G5242><s%>

Or <S%G1535><s%> to governors, <S%G2232><s%> as to them that are sent <S%G3992><s%> by him for the punishment <S%G1557><s%> of evildoers, <S%G2555><s%> and for the praise <S%G1868><s%> of them that do <S%G17><s%> well. <S%G17><s%>

For so <S%G3779><s%> is the will <S%G2307><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> that with well <S%G15><s%> doing <S%G15><s%> you may put <S%G5392><s%> to silence <S%G5392><s%> the ignorance <S%G56><s%> of foolish <S%G878><s%> men: <S%G444><s%>

As free, <S%G1658><s%> and not using <S%G2192><s%> your <S%G3588><s%> liberty <S%G1657><s%> for a cloak <S%G1942><s%> of maliciousness, <S%G2549><s%> but as the servants <S%G1401><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>
Honor <S%G5091><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> men. Love <S%G25><s%> the brotherhood. <S%G81><s%> Fear <S%G5399><s%> God. <S%G2316><s%> Honor <S%G5091><s%> the king. <S%G935><s%>

Servants, <S%G3610><s%> be subject <S%G5293><s%> to your <S%G3588><s%> masters <S%G1203><s%> with all <S%G3956><s%> fear; <S%G5401><s%> not only <S%G3440><s%> to the good <S%G18><s%> and gentle, <S%G1933><s%> but also <S%G2532><s%> to the fraudulent. <S%G4646><s%>

For this <S%G5124><s%> is thank worthy, <S%G5485><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> a man <S%G5100><s%> for conscience <S%G4893><s%> toward God <S%G2316><s%> endure <S%G5297><s%> grief, <S%G3077><s%> suffering <S%G3958><s%> wrongfully. <S%G95><s%>

For what <S%G4169><s%> glory <S%G2811><s%> is it, if, <S%G1487><s%> when you be buffeted <S%G2852><s%> for your faults, <S%G264><s%> you shall take it patiently? <S%G5278><s%> but if, <S%G1487><s%> when you do <S%G15><s%> well, <S%G15><s%> and suffer <S%G3958><s%> for it, you take it patiently, <S%G5278><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> is acceptable <S%G5485><s%> with God. <S%G2316><s%>

For even hereunto <S%G1519><s%> <S%G5124><s%> were you called: <S%G2564><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> Christ <S%G5547><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> suffered <S%G3958><s%> for us, leaving <S%G5277><s%> us an example, <S%G5261><s%> that you should follow <S%G1872><s%> his steps: <S%G2487><s%>
Who <S%G3739><s%> did <S%G4160><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> sin, <S%G266><s%> neither <S%G3761><s%> was guile <S%G1388><s%> found <S%G2147><s%> in his mouth: <S%G4750><s%>

Who, <S%G3739><s%> when he was reviled, <S%G3058><s%> reviled <S%G486><s%> not again; <S%G486><s%> when he suffered, <S%G3958><s%> he threatened <S%G546><s%> not; but committed <S%G3860><s%> himself to him that judges <S%G2919><s%> righteously: <S%G1346><s%>

Who <S%G3739><s%> his own <S%G848><s%> self <S%G846><s%> bore <S%G399><s%> our sins <S%G266><s%> in his own body <S%G4983><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the tree, <S%G3586><s%> that we, being dead <S%G581><s%> to sins, <S%G266><s%> should live <S%G2198><s%> to righteousness: <S%G1343><s%> by whose <S%G3739><s%> stripes <S%G3468><s%> you were healed. <S%G2390><s%>

For you were as sheep <S%G4263><s%> going <S%G4105><s%> astray; <S%G4105><s%> but are now <S%G3568><s%> returned <S%G1994><s%> to the Shepherd <S%G4166><s%> and Bishop <S%G1985><s%> of your <S%G5216><s%> souls. <S%G5590><s%>
